title: Timing of CNAs
text: vignette, walk complete analysis longitudinal cancer sequencing data single patient acute myeloid leukemia developed resistance immunological therapy. real-world example highlights can used identify interpret clinically relevant genomic events. Create TOSCA object Fit appropriate model Check quality fit Visualise result fit

title: Authors and Citation
text: Alice Antonello. Author, maintainer. Riccardo Bergamin. Author.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Antonello , Bergamin R (2026). TOSCA: TOSCA - Timing Somatic Copy number Alterations. R package version 0.1.0, https://aliceantonello.github.io/TOSCA/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {TOSCA: TOSCA - Timing Of Somatic Copy number Alterations},   author = {Alice Antonello and Riccardo Bergamin},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://aliceantonello.github.io/TOSCA/}, }

what: TOSCA - Timing Of Somatic Copy number Alterations
title: TOSCA - Timing Of Somatic Copy number Alterations
text: TOSCA packege inferring timing real time clonal subclonal somatic copy numbers (SCNA) type 2:0, 2:1 2:2, driver events altering mutation rate. input data result clonal signature deconvolution analyses performed WGS longitudinal data.

title: TOSCA - Timing Of Somatic Copy number Alterations
text: use TOSCA, please cite: * Timing cancer genomics driver events around therapy Riccardo Bergamin, Alice Antonello, Giulio Caravagna.

title: TOSCA - Timing Of Somatic Copy number Alterations

what: Infer the timing of the events of interest fitting the appropriate TOSCA model — fit
title: Infer the timing of the events of interest fitting the appropriate TOSCA model — fit
text: Infer timing events interest fitting appropriate TOSCA model

title: Infer the timing of the events of interest fitting the appropriate TOSCA model — fit
code: fit(   x,   n_iterations = 10000,   n_chains = 4,   warm_up = 5000,   cores = 4,   adapt_delta = 0.95,   stepsize = 0.01,   seed = 5,   model_name = "Driver",   dormancy = F,   verbose = F,   initialisation = F,   init_fun = NULL,   max_mrca = NA,   reg_dormancy = 0 )

title: Infer the timing of the events of interest fitting the appropriate TOSCA model — fit
text: x TOSCA object n_iterations Number iteration MCMC chain. default 10000. n_chains positive integer specifying number Markov chains. default 4. warm_up positive integer specifying number warmup (aka burnin) iterations per chain. default 5000. cores Number cores use executing chains parallel adapt_delta target acceptance probability Metropolis step HMC. default 0.95. stepsize far particle moves leapfrog step along trajectory. default 0.01. seed seed computation. Default 5. model_name Name model: "CNA" "Driver" dormancy Boolean specifying model include dormancy (available "CNA" model). default F verbose Boolen specifying fit function output iterations progression. default F. initialisation Boolean, default= F. true, must specify init_fun init_fun Vector initial values used initialisation = T. max_mrca maximun date t_mrca reg_dormancy Boolean (0 1). reg_dormancy = 0, likelihood regularisation imposed timing dormancy end

title: Infer the timing of the events of interest fitting the appropriate TOSCA model — fit
text: TOSCA object

title: Infer the timing of the events of interest fitting the appropriate TOSCA model — fit
code: library(TOSCA) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) data("exampleData_CNA") set.seed(123) mutations = exampleData_CNA$Mutations parameters = exampleData_CNA$Parameters samples = exampleData_CNA$Samples therapies = exampleData_CNA$Therapies x = init(mutations=mutations, samples=samples, therapies=therapies, parameters=parameters) #> Error in init(mutations = mutations, samples = samples, therapies = therapies,     parameters = parameters): Input must be a data.frame. fit = TOSCA::fit(x, model_name='CNA',                  n_iterations = 10000,                  n_chains = 4,                  warm_up = 5000) #> Error: object 'x' not found

what: Get mean, mode and q5, q95 — get_fit_summary
title: Get mean, mode and q5, q95 — get_fit_summary
text: Get mean, mode q5, q95

title: Get mean, mode and q5, q95 — get_fit_summary
code: get_fit_summary(   x,   parameter = NULL,   cna_length = NULL,   drug_name = NULL,   quantiles = c(5, 95) )

title: Get mean, mode and q5, q95 — get_fit_summary
text: x TOSCA obj parameter string, optional. Parameter interest. nothing provided function returns mean, mode q5, q95, parameters. Possible values: t_eca, t_mrca, t_cna, t_driver, omega, mu_th_step, mu_driver. cna_length parameter == t_cna, length CNA interest drug_name parameter == mu_th_step, name drug interest quantiles vector quantiles, default (5, 95)

title: Get mean, mode and q5, q95 — get_fit_summary
text: dataframe summarising inference results

title: Get mean, mode and q5, q95 — get_fit_summary
code: data("exampleFit") get_fit_summary(exampleFit, parameter = "t_cna", cna_length = 4.5e+08, quantiles=c(5, 95)) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   variable median    mean       rhat ess_bulk q5        q95       #>   <chr>    <chr>     <chr>     <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>     <chr>     #> 1 t_cna[2] 2008-4-25 2008-4-23  1.00   40515. 2008-2-13 2008-6-27 get_fit_summary(exampleFit, parameter = "mu_th_step", drug_name = "Drug 2", quantiles=c(2, 98)) #> # A tibble: 1 × 7 #>   variable  median       mean              rhat ess_bulk q2            q98       #>   <chr>     <chr>        <chr>            <dbl>    <dbl> <chr>         <chr>     #> 1 mu_Drug 2 1.131765e-07 1.2205458505e-07 1.000   14291. 6.6796186e-08 2.428349…

title: Get inference data — get_inference_data
text: Get inference data

title: Get inference data — get_inference_data
code: get_inference_data(x, model, dormancy = F, max_mrca = NA, reg_dormancy = 0)

title: Get inference data — get_inference_data
text: x TOSCA obj model string, either "CNA" "Driver" dormancy boolean, model == "CNA", possible include dormancy max_mrca date "YYYY-mm-dd" format, maximum date MRCA born (< date second sample) reg_dormancy boolean (0 1), optional regularisation growth imposed case dormancy

title: Get inference data — get_inference_data
text: list arguments passed stan fit function

title: Initialise TOSCA object — init
text: Initialise TOSCA object

title: Initialise TOSCA object — init
Initialise TOSCA object — init
text: mutations data.frame information mutation falling timed branches. 1. Name (str), name choosing cluster mutations 2. Length (int), length genomic segment sit 3. Karyptype (str), karyotype genomic segment sit "Major:minor" (ex "1:1") 4. Type (str), one following: "clock-like primary", "clock-like relapse", "alpha", "beta", "driver", name mutagenic drug associated reported therapies dataframe 5. Value (int), number mutations parameters data.frame parameters required inference. 1. Name (str), 2. Value (real), 3. Index (int) samples data.frame name collection date longitudinal samples + date birth (optional). 1. Name (str), name sample 2. Date (date) date collection format "YYYY-mm-dd" therapies data.frame name exposure period therapies affecting mutation accumulation process. 1. Name (str) 2. Class (str), one following : "Mutagenic step", "Mutagenic cauchy", "Driver responsive", "Chemotherapy inducing dormancy" 3. Start (date), start cicle therapy format "YYYY-mm-dd" 4. End (date), end cicle therapy format "YYYY-mm-dd" sample_name string name sample

title: Initialise TOSCA object — init
text: TOSCA object

title: Initialise TOSCA object — init
code: library(TOSCA) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) data("exampleData_CNA") mutations = exampleData_CNA$Mutations parameters = exampleData_CNA$Parameters samples = exampleData_CNA$Samples therapies = exampleData_CNA$Therapies  x = init(mutations=mutations, samples=samples, therapies=therapies, parameters=parameters) #> Error in init(mutations = mutations, samples = samples, therapies = therapies,     parameters = parameters): Input must be a data.frame.
